text: we have a really wonderful warm welcome
whenever we do travel into North Korea
and bring our guests it's the first
thing that people notice the minute they
arrive and I'm talking the minute they
arrive in the airport the customs
officials are friendly and they
recognize me because I go quite
frequently and build York around a
little bit and while they're writing
down the make and number of your mobile
phone but they're there they're
extremely warm and friendly and we're
very obviously traveling with North
Korean tour guides so we're not there
sneaking about there's no reason for
anyone to be that suspicious of us in
Pyongyang they're more used to seeing
foreigners now it's like China maybe 20
or so years ago where people will
cautiously say hello in the street and
and you know generally it's not such a
shock for them you're showing images
that frankly the North Korean government
would like you to show this is life that
is not too bad you've got people working
in a factory you've got to packet of
crisps that looks pretty edible chips so
what about those places where you can't
go they do have packets of crisps that
are edible and they do have all the
people whose pictures I'm taking and the
places that we're going they do exist
and what I will also say is that there
is a very narrow field of perception
when it comes to North Korea in the
Western world there are certain images
which are replicated again and again
because it serves a narrative and so
what we're doing is we're countering it
by saying there is other things that are
happening here and there 25 million
people living in this country and they
do we're clothes and they do laugh with
their friends and they do fight with
their husbands and they do worry about
things that we worry about and I think
that the more that you can humanize
people and sure that there are more
similarities between us than things that
divide us then that of course is a good
thing and it's very difficult for people
to understand because it's quite a
complex idea when you're so used to
seeing people who seem brainwashed
people who seem to hate the ways people
who seem to constantly be marching in
time but if you show a picture of
someone fishing then then the ideas well
that must be fake that's not real and
it's like actually it's all part of a
complex and bigger reality
you
